snippet: A seemingly offhand remark by Secretary of State John Kerry actually grew out of talks between Russia and the United States, and it allowed Vladimir V. Putin to seize control of the Syria debate.
abstract: Russia's proposal to resolve chemical weapons crisis in Syria by having country surrender its stockpiles of poison gas to international community, idea that seemed to come out of blue, was actually born out of year's worth of talks between Pres Obama and Russian Pres Vladimir Putin; plan, which allows Putin to seize control of Syria debate, has been tentatively embraced by Obama, but some are questioning Putin's motives.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Moscow, and Robert F. Worth from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A seemingly offhand remark by Secretary of State John Kerry actually grew out of talks between Russia and the United States, and it allowed Vladimir V. Putin to seize control of the Syria debate.

headline.main: An Unlikely Evolution, From Casual Proposal to Possible Resolution
headline.print_headline: An Unlikely Evolution, From Casual Proposal To Possible Resolution
